scopecontent.p: This is a collection of actors' role books from the late nineteenth century. Each book contains cues, actions, and lines for one part in a play. Most of the books are in manuscript, possibly in the hand of Phil. Aug. Anderson. There are also several typed role books, typed by H. A. Richardson. Books include the parts of Uncle Peterkill in Larks, King Creon in Medea, and Philip Darcy in Musette. The books are for plays performed in Boston, Philadelphia, Albany, and Baltimore between 1872 and 1878. The collection also includes a role book for Hunted Down in the hand of Laura Keene.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
